224. Lusignan, (Mrs. Cyrille)

1907. Lusignan, Mrs. Cyril
Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and will be sent to Saskatchewan Archives Board, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.

Name: Mrs. Caroline Lumsden
Address: 257 Main Street
Birthplace: England

1. INTRODUCTION QUESTIONS
   What year did you start housekeeping in western Canada? 1907
   Where did you set up housekeeping? Regina, Saskatchewan
   Where had you been living before that? Butte, Montana
   For how many people did you prepare meals? 4
   How far was it to your nearest store? 3.5 miles
   How often could a visit be made to the store? 2 months
   What groceries did you usually buy in those earlier years?
   dry fruit flour salt sugar pepper

2. FLOUR AND GRAIN PRODUCTS
   What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? American
   In what quantities did you buy it? 100 lb
   What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $3.25
   How much did you use groats flour?
   Whole wheat flour?
   Was flour milled locally? Yes, how far away? 3 miles, that year? 1912
   What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? about 50¢
   What other grain products did you use?
   Cornmeal? Yes
   Whole wheat? Yes
   Farina? Yes
   Other?
   Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? No
   How did you grind it?

Potatoes 1908, Cabbages 1908, Carrots 1908, Onions 1908,
Turnips 1908, Beets 1908.

What year did you first preserve meat by canning? 1920.
